sen.j: 山口 宗永（やまぐち むねなが、生年不詳 － 慶長5年8月3日 (旧暦)（1600年9月10日））は、戦国時代 (日本)後期から江戸時代初期の大名で加賀国大聖寺六万石余。
sen.e: Munenaga YAMAGUCHI (the year of birth unknown and died on September 10, 1600) was daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the late Sengoku period and the early Edo period and had sixty thousand goku of Daisho-ji Temple, Kaga Province.

Munenaga YAMAGUCHI (the year of birth unknown - September 10, 1600) was daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) from the late Sengoku period to the early Edo period with 6,000 goku of Daishoji Domain, Kaga Province.

Munenaga YAMAGUCHI (the year of birth unknown - September 10, 1600) was daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) from the late Sengoku period to the early Edo period with 6,000 goku of Daishoji Domain, Kaga Province.

sen.j: 近江国淀城主だったと言われる 玄蕃允、玄蕃頭。
sen.e: It was said he was the head of Yodo castle in Omi Province and Genbaryo (a government official in charge of maintaining the list of monks and entertaining envoys from foreign countries) and Genba no kami (the chief of Genbaryo).

It was said he was the head of Yodo-jo Castle in Omi Province and Genbaryo (a government official in charge of maintaining the list of priests and entertaining envoys from foreign countries) and Genba no kami (the chief of Genbaryo).
sen.cmt: Yodo castle を Yodo-jo Castle に修正しました。monk を priest に修正しました。
sen.e: It was said he was the head of Yodo-jo Castle in Omi Province and Genbaryo (a government official in charge of maintaining the list of priests and entertaining envoys from foreign countries) and Genba no kami (the chief of Genbaryo).

sen.j: 別名は山口 正弘。
sen.e: Another name was Masahiro YAMAGUCHI.
He is also called Masahiro YAMAGUCHI.
sen.cmt: Another name was を He is also called に修正しました。
sen.e: He is also called Masahiro YAMAGUCHI.

sen.j: 慶長2年（1597年）、小早川家を継いだ小早川秀秋の補佐役として豊臣政権から送り込まれた。
sen.e: In 1597, he was sent into the Kobayakawa family as an assistant to Hideaki KOBAYAKAWA from the Toyotomi government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1597, he was sent into the Kobayakawa family as an assistant to Hideaki KOBAYAKAWA from the Toyotomi government.
In 1597, he was sent into the Kobayakawa family as an assistant to Hideaki KOBAYAKAWA from the Toyotomi government.

sen.j: 小早川領に太閤検地を行ったり、慶長の役では朝鮮に渡って秀秋を補佐した。
sen.e: He conducted Taiko-kenchi (Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's nationwide cadastral surveys) in the Kobayakawa territory and at the time of keicho no eki (one of Japanese invasions of Korea), he went to Korea and assisted Hidearki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He conducted Taiko-kenchi (Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's nationwide cadastral surveys) in the Kobayakawa territory and at the time of keicho no eki (one of Japanese invasions of Korea), he went to Korea and assisted Hidearki.

He conducted Taiko-kenchi (Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's nationwide cadastral surveys) in the Kobayakawa territory and at the time of keicho no eki (one of Japanese invasions of Korea), he went to Korea and assisted Hidearki.

sen.j: 蔚山城の戦いでは小早川勢を率いて加藤清正らの籠城する蔚山倭城を救援した。
sen.e: In the Battle of Ulsan, he commanded the Kobayakawa force and rescued Urusan wajo Castle (Japanese style castle) where Kiyomasa KATO and his followers confined themselves.
In the Battle of Ulsan, he commanded the Kobayakawa force and rescued Urusan wajo Castle (Japanese style castle) where Kiyomasa KATO and his followers confined themselves.
In the Battle of Ulsan, he commanded the Kobayakawa force and rescued Urusan wajo Castle (Japanese style castle) where Kiyomasa KATO and his followers confined themselves.

sen.j: 秀秋とは折り合い悪く、秀秋が慶長3年（1598年）に筑前名島から越前北庄へ転封された時に加賀大聖寺の独立大名に取り立てられた。
sen.e: He was on bad terms with Hideaki and when Hideaki was transferred from Chikuzen Najima to Echizen Hokusho, he became the independent daimyo of Kaga Daisei-ji Temple.
He was on bad terms with Hideaki and when Hideaki was transferred from Chikuzen Najima to Echizen Hokusho, he became the independent daimyo of Kaga Daishoji Domain.
sen.cmt: Daisei-ji Temple を Daishoji Domain に修正しました。※加賀大聖寺は寺院名ではなく地名であり、藩の名前です。
sen.e: He was on bad terms with Hideaki and when Hideaki was transferred from Chikuzen Najima to Echizen Hokusho, he became the independent daimyo of Kaga Daishoji Domain.

sen.j: 子に長男右京亮山口修弘、次男左馬助山口弘定、池田重利室らがあった。
sen.e: His children included Nagahiro YAMAGUCHI, the first son and Ukyo no suke (Assistant master of the Western Capital Offices), Hirosada YAMAGUCHI, the second son and Sameryo (trainer of the left of horses owned by the Imperial Court) and a wife of Shigetoshi IKEDA.

His children included Nagahiro YAMAGUCHI, the first son and Ukyo no suke (Assistant master of the Western Capital Offices), Hirosada YAMAGUCHI, the second son and Sameryo (trainer of the left of horses owned by the Imperial Court) and a wife of Shigetoshi IKEDA.

His children included Nagahiro YAMAGUCHI, the first son and Ukyo no suke (Assistant master of the Western Capital Offices), Hirosada YAMAGUCHI, the second son and Sameryo (trainer of the left of horses owned by the Imperial Court) and a wife of Shigetoshi IKEDA.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の役では慶長5年7月26日に加賀金沢の前田利長は約20000の大軍を率いて金沢城を出撃し、西軍の丹羽長重の拠る小松城を攻撃するかに見えた。
sen.e: In September 3, 1600, in the event of Sekigahara no eki, Toshiie MAEDA, the feudal lord of Kaga Kanazawa Domein seemed to make a sortie heading about 20000 troops from Kanazawa-jo Castle and attack Komatsu -jo Castle, which was the Western Camp, Nagamasa NIWA's stronghold.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On September 3, 1600, in the Battle of Sekigahara, Toshiie MAEDA of Kaga Kanazawa Domain seemed to make a sortie heading about 20,000 troops from Kanazawa-jo Castle and attack Komatsu-jo Castle, which was the Western Camp, Nagamasa NIWA's stronghold.

On September 3, 1600, in the Battle of Sekigahara, Toshiie MAEDA of Kaga Kanazawa Domain seemed to make a sortie heading about 20,000 troops from Kanazawa-jo Castle and attack Komatsu-jo Castle, which was the Western Camp, Nagamasa NIWA's stronghold.

sen.j: 急遽、これを避けて8月1日に加賀松山城に入城した。
sen.e: However, he suddenly changed his strategy and entered Kaga Matsuyama -jo Castle on September 8.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he suddenly changed his strategy and entered Kaga Matsuyama -jo Castle on September 8.
However, he suddenly changed his strategy and entered Kaga Matsuyama -jo Castle on September 8.

sen.j: 山口宗永はその危急を聞いて、大聖寺城の防備を堅め、北ノ庄城の青木一矩や小松城の丹羽長重に救援依頼の使者を派したが間に合わなかった。
sen.e: When hearing that news, Munenaga YAMAGCHI reinforced the defenses of Daishoji-jo Castle and sent envoys to Kazunori AOKI, the head of Kitanosho-jo Castle and Nagashige NIWA, the head of Komatsu-jo Castle in order to request for help, but it was too late.

When hearing that news, Munenaga YAMAGUCHI reinforced the defenses of Daishoji-jo Castle and sent envoys to Kazunori AOKI, the head of Kitanosho-jo Castle and Nagashige NIWA, the head of Komatsu-jo Castle in order to request for help, but it was too late.
sen.cmt: YAMAGCHI を YAMAGUCHI に修正しました。
sen.e: When hearing that news, Munenaga YAMAGUCHI reinforced the defenses of Daishoji-jo Castle and sent envoys to Kazunori AOKI, the head of Kitanosho-jo Castle and Nagashige NIWA, the head of Komatsu-jo Castle in order to request for help, but it was too late.

sen.j: 翌2日、利長は九里九郎兵衛・村井久左衛門を使者として大聖寺城に籠もる山口宗永に降伏を勧告した。
sen.e: Two days later, Toshinaga sent envoys, Kurobei KURI and Saemon MURAI to urge Munenaga who confined himself in Daishoji-jo Castle to surrender.
Two days later, Toshinaga sent envoys, Kurobei KURI and Saemon MURAI to urge Munenaga who confined himself in Daishoji-jo Castle to surrender.
Two days later, Toshinaga sent envoys, Kurobei KURI and Saemon MURAI to urge Munenaga who confined himself in Daishoji-jo Castle to surrender.

sen.j: 宗永は利長の攻撃に憤激して勧告を拒否した。
sen.e: Munenaga rejected Toshinaga's advice because he got infuriated over the Toshinaga's attacks.
Munenaga rejected Toshinaga's advice because he got infuriated over the Toshinaga's attacks.
Munenaga rejected Toshinaga's advice because he got infuriated over the Toshinaga's attacks.

sen.j: 前田勢は数を嵩にきて城攻めを行った。
sen.e: The MAEDA force increased the number of its troops and attacked the castle.
The Maeda force increased the number of its troops and attacked the castle.
sen.cmt: MAEDA を Maeda に修正しました。※原文「嵩にきて」は「嵩にかかって」の誤りかと思われます。嵩にかける：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B5%A9%E3%81%AB%E6%87%B8%E3%81%8B%E3%82%8B笠に着る：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E7%AC%A0%E3%81%AB%E7%9D%80%E3%82%8B
sen.e: The Maeda force increased the number of its troops and attacked the castle.

sen.j: 守る山口軍も宗永の子右京亮修弘が城近くに伏兵を潜ませて迎撃の指揮をとったが、前田勢の先鋒山崎長徳に発見されてしまった。
sen.e: On the side of the YAMAGUCHI force, Munenaga's son, Ukyo no suke, Nagahiro took the initiative to defend and fight back making an ambush near the Castle, but Nagatoku YAMAMZAKI, a spearhead of the MAEDA force, found it.

On the side of the Yamaguchi force, Munenaga's son, Ukyo no suke, Nagahiro took the initiative to defend and fight back making an ambush near the Castle, but Nagatoku YAMAMZAKI, a spearhead of the Maeda force, found it.
sen.cmt: 苗字のみの表記を語頭のみ大文字に修正しました。Castle を castle に修正しました。
sen.e: On the side of the Yamaguchi force, Munenaga's son, Ukyo no suke, Nagahiro took the initiative to defend and fight back making an ambush near the Castle, but Nagatoku YAMAMZAKI, a spearhead of the Maeda force, found it.

sen.j: ここに戦いの幕が切って落とされた。
sen.e: This was the time when the battle broke out.
This was the time when the battle broke out.
This was the time when the battle broke out.

sen.j: 野戦では敗戦した山口勢は敗兵を収容し、ただちに篭城戦の構えをとった。
sen.e: The YAMAGUCHI force, suffering a defeat outside, picked up its soldiers and immediately got ready for the battle in its stronghold.
The Yamaguchi force, suffering a defeat outside, picked up its soldiers and immediately got ready for the battle in its stronghold.
sen.cmt: 苗字のみの表記を語頭のみ大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: The Yamaguchi force, suffering a defeat outside, picked up its soldiers and immediately got ready for the battle in its stronghold.

sen.j: 前田勢も先鋒の山崎隊に加えて長連龍隊などの後続の軍勢も参戦して城の外周で激戦が展開された。
sen.e: In addition to the spearhead, the YAMAZAKI squad, another squad such as the Tsuratatsu CHO squad joined the MAEDA force and fought desperately outside of the Castle.
In addition to the spearhead, the Yamazaki squad, another squad such as the Tsuratatsu CHO squad joined the Maeda force and fought desperately outside of the castle.
sen.cmt: 苗字のみの表記を語頭のみ大文字に修正しました。Castle を castle に修正しました。
sen.e: In addition to the spearhead, the Yamazaki squad, another squad such as the Tsuratatsu CHO squad joined the Maeda force and fought desperately outside of the castle.

sen.j: 山口修弘は果敢に出撃してしたたかに前田勢に被害を与えたが前田勢の鉄砲隊の一斉射撃を受けて、やむなく城内に退却する。
sen.e: Nagahiro YMAMGUCHI valiantly made a sortie and did damage to the MAEDA force, but he was saluted with a volley from the gun squad of the MAEDA force and he was forced to retreat to the Castle.
Nagahiro YMAMGUCHI valiantly made a sortie and did damage to the MAEDA force, but he was saluted with a volley from the gun squad of the MAEDA force and he was forced to retreat to the castle.
sen.cmt: 苗字のみの表記を語頭のみ大文字に修正しました。Castle を castle に修正しました。
sen.e: Nagahiro YMAMGUCHI valiantly made a sortie and did damage to the MAEDA force, but he was saluted with a volley from the gun squad of the MAEDA force and he was forced to retreat to the castle.

sen.j: 大軍の前田勢はひた押しに押し進むが、山口宗永や山口修弘らが率いる山口勢もひるまず果敢に反撃した。
sen.e: The huge MAEDA force advanced upon the enemy, but the YAMAGUCHI force headed by Munenaga and Nagahiro fought back dauntlessly.
The huge Maeda force advanced upon the enemy, but the Yamaguchi force headed by Munenaga and Nagahiro fought back dauntlessly.
sen.cmt: 苗字のみの表記を語頭のみ大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: The huge Maeda force advanced upon the enemy, but the Yamaguchi force headed by Munenaga and Nagahiro fought back dauntlessly.

sen.j: しかし、20000の大軍の前にわずか500余の兵しか要しない山口勢では敵うはずもなく、ついに宗永は塀の上から降伏の意思を伝えた。
sen.e: However, the Yamaguchi force with about 500 troops was no match for the heavy force with 20000 troops, therefore, eventually, Munenaga announced the surrender on the wall.
However, the Yamaguchi force with about 500 troops was no match for the heavy force with 20,000 troops, therefore, eventually, Munenaga announced the surrender over the wall.
sen.cmt: 20000 を 20,000 に修正しました。on を over に修正しました。
sen.e: However, the Yamaguchi force with about 500 troops was no match for the heavy force with 20,000 troops, therefore, eventually, Munenaga announced the surrender over the wall.

sen.j: しかし、多くの兵を失った前田勢は復讐心に燃えてこれを許さず、城内に突入した。
sen.e: But, the MAEDA force did not accept it, because they lost a lot of soldiers and they rushed into the Castle out of revenge.
But, the Maeda force did not accept it, because they lost a lot of soldiers and they rushed into the castle out of revenge.
sen.cmt: 苗字のみの表記を語頭のみ大文字に修正しました。Castle を castle に修正しました。
sen.e: But, the Maeda force did not accept it, because they lost a lot of soldiers and they rushed into the castle out of revenge.

sen.j: 8月3日の夕方に、ついに大聖寺城は陥落した。
sen.e: On September 10, Daishoji-jo Castle finally fell.
On the evening of September 10, Daishoji-jo Castle finally fell.
sen.cmt: 「夕方に」訳漏れのため evening of を補って対応しました。
sen.e: On the evening of September 10, Daishoji-jo Castle finally fell.

sen.j: 山口宗永と山口修弘の墓は石川県加賀市大聖寺神明町にある全昌寺にある。
sen.e: The graves of Munenaga YAMAGUCHI and Nagahiro YAMAGUCHI were in Zensho-ji Temple located in Shinmei-cho Daishoji Kaga City Ishikawa Prefecture.
The graves of Munenaga YAMAGUCHI and Nagahiro YAMAGUCHI were in Zensho-ji Temple located in Daishoji Shinmei-cho, Kaga City, Ishikawa Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 住所部分を全文修正しました。
sen.e: The graves of Munenaga YAMAGUCHI and Nagahiro YAMAGUCHI were in Zensho-ji Temple located in Daishoji Shinmei-cho, Kaga City, Ishikawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 宗永の遺児、山口弘定は父の遺志を継いで、大坂城に入城することになる。
sen.e: Hirosada YAMAGUCHI, the child Munenage left behind, carried out his father's last wish and entered Osaka-jo Castle.
Hirosada YAMAGUCHI, the child Munenage left behind, carried out his father's last wish and entered Osaka-jo Castle.
Hirosada YAMAGUCHI, the child Munenage left behind, carried out his father's last wish and entered Osaka-jo Castle.

sen.j: なお、子孫は松江藩に仕え、明治維新後は日銀の理事となる山口宗義がいる。
sen.e: The descendants served Matsue Domain and after Meiji Restoration, one of the descendants, Muneyoshi YAMAGUCHI became the director of the Bank of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The descendants served Matsue Domain and after the Meiji Restoration, one of the descendants, Muneyoshi YAMAGUCHI became the director of the Bank of Japan.
sen.cmt: Meiji Restoration に the を追記しました。
sen.e: The descendants served Matsue Domain and after the Meiji Restoration, one of the descendants, Muneyoshi YAMAGUCHI became the director of the Bank of Japan.

sen.j: そしてその息子であり太平洋戦争においてミッドウェー海戦で第二航空戦隊を指揮し、戦死した海軍中将山口多聞。
sen.e: His son, the vice admiral, Tamon YAMAGUCHI took the initiative to the second Aviation squadron in the Battle of Midway Island at the time of the World WarⅡand then, he was killed in action.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His son, the vice admiral, Tamon YAMAGUCHI took the initiative to the second Aviation squadron in the Battle of Midway Island at the time of the World WarⅡand then, he was killed in action.
His son, the vice admiral, Tamon YAMAGUCHI took the initiative to the second Aviation squadron in the Battle of Midway Island at the time of the World WarⅡand then, he was killed in action.

sen.j: 宗義の玄孫にはレーシングドライバーの山口礼がいる。
sen.e: Muneyoshi's great-great-grandchild is a racing driver, Rei YAMAGUCHI..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Muneyoshi's great-great-grandchild is a racing driver, Rei YAMAGUCHI..
Muneyoshi's great-great-grandchild is a racing driver, Rei YAMAGUCHI..
